meanings.definition: The quality of being straightforward or honest in communication.
meanings.sent1: Her directnesses in conversation always made people trust her.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the directnesses of his feedback.
meanings.sent3: His directnesses in telling jokes often caught us off guard.
meanings.sent4: The directnesses of her gaze seemed to pierce through any facade.
meanings.sent5: The directnesses of the teacher's instructions helped the students understand clearly.

meanings.definition: The act of guiding or supervising something.
meanings.sent1: The directnesses of the coach led the team to victory.
meanings.sent2: She took on the directnesses of managing the project with confidence.
meanings.sent3: The directnesses of the GPS voice made the road trip entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His directnesses in steering the conversation kept everyone engaged.
meanings.sent5: The directnesses of the traffic officer ensured smooth flow on the road.

meanings.definition: The state of being without anything in between.
meanings.sent1: The directnesses of the path allowed for a clear view of the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The directnesses of the relationship between them was refreshing.
meanings.sent3: The directnesses of the glass bridge made some visitors nervous.
meanings.sent4: The directnesses of the horizon meeting the ocean was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The directnesses of the tunnel made it feel like a shortcut through the mountain.
